titleInfo.title: Report of the Committee of Claims, 1797

mods.abstract: Report of the Committee of Claims, on the Petition of the Widow of the Late Scolacuttaw, or Hanging Maw, One of the Chiefs of the Cherokee Nation of Indians. 17th January 1797, referred to the Committee of the whole House, to whom is committed the report of the Committee on Claims on the petition of James Ore. [Philadelphia]. 1797. 1 pc., folded. The widow petitions the U.S. House of Representatives for financial relief after her husband and “a number of well disposed Indians” were killed by John Beard and other armed men in an attack on the Tennessee frontier in 1793. Produced by the United States Congress Committee on Claims. Believed to have been done of the press of William Ross. One of eight known copies. This copy belonged to Samuel Sitgreaves, a Federalist party member of the House of Representatives from Pennsylvania from 1795 to 1798.

name.namePart: United States Congress Committee on Claims
